alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes; Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 28 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT SUNDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Sunday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT...Smoke from the largest fires in the state will be rapidly transported toward the northeast through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. The most impactful near surface smoke will remain in close proximity to the fires perimeters particularly portions of the Mimbres and Lower Rio Grande Valleys in southwest New Mexico. Additionally, layers of dense smoke aloft will be carried much farther down wind than recent days. This includes areas between Belen and Socorro northeastward toward Abo Pass, Mountainair, Estancia, Moriarty and Clines Corners along I-40. Smoke along the east slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains will also push farther northeast resulting in diminished air quality for parts of the I-25 corridor in northeast New Mexico and surrounding areas. Overall, haze will be more persistent away from the larger fires and areas of blowing dust will, at times, contribute to diminished air quality for lower elevations through the evening. * WHERE...The most significant impacts from smoke are expected to persist across much of Catron, Socorro, northern Grant, northwest Lincoln, northern Luna, Sierra and southwest Torrance counties in central and southwest New Mexico and western San Miguel, western Mora and western Colfax counties in north-central New Mexico. More details on impacted locations and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN...Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Sunday, May 29.
